intro: Leucosceptrum canum, commonly known as the alpine avens, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of North America. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically hairy and lance-shaped, adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions. Leucosceptrum canum plays an important ecological role in alpine ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
